intro: Thunbergia bodinieri, commonly known as the Madagascar arum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves and showy, spathiflorous inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers surrounded by a leaf-like bract. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical and subtropical gardens. Thunbergia bodinieri thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade.
